subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Martina Schild battled biting cold and a slick track in Lake Louise, Alberta, in winning the season-opening women’s super-G in 1 minute 16.21 seconds for her first World Cup victory. Lindsey Vonn, formerly Lindsey Kildow, who won Saturday’s downhill, fell, hit a gate and slid into the fencing. Vonn said she was sore and bruised but not seriously injured.
